article.title: 11 Awesome Things To Do In Hat Yai, South Thailand, At Night
article.lead_paragraph:
There is a large range of options for your extraordinary evenings in Hat Yai, a vibrant gem in Southern Thailand. There is more to this charming city than the amazing Wat Hat Yai Nai, which houses a breathtaking reclining Buddha statue (the third largest in the world), or the Ton Nga Chang Waterfall. The city has more to offer when the sun disappears below the horizon, including night markets, museums and a great selection of pubs and restaurants.

Regardless of your mood, let these 11 best picks help you decide what to do in Hat Yai, at night.
article.proposal:
1. Try Thai street foods at Greenway Night Market
http://x10sapient.blogspot.co.id/2016/08/greenway-night-market-hatyai.html
2. Go shopping at Asean Trade Bazaar
https://www.tripadvisor.com/Attraction_Review-g297921-d4289733-Reviews-Asean_Trade_Bazaar-Hat_Yai_Songkhla_Province.html
3. Get amazed by Magic Eye 3D Museum
https://www.triphobo.com/places/hat-yai-thailand/magic-eye-3d-museum
4. Stroll down the Asian Trade Market's street
https://www.triphobo.com/places/hat-yai-thailand/asian-trade-market
5. Visit Municipal Park
https://www.triphobo.com/places/hat-yai-thailand/municipal-park
6. Test the bargaining skill at Hat Yai Floating Market
https://www.triphobo.com/places/hat-yai-thailand/floating-market
7. Chill out at Nectar Pub Hatyai
https://www.tripadvisor.com/Attraction_Review-g297921-d7702564-Reviews-Nectar_Pub_Hatyai-Hat_Yai_Songkhla_Province.html
8. Enjoy live music at Westside Saloon Pub and Restaurant
https://foursquare.com/v/westside-saloon-pub--restaurant/4da6f8c904377705c3038116
9. Have Thai dinner at Jae Lek Restaurant
https://www.tripadvisor.com/Restaurant_Review-g297921-d7734879-Reviews-Jae_Lek-Hat_Yai_Songkhla_Province.html
10. Sip a cup of hot coffee at Attention Cafe
https://www.tripadvisor.com/Restaurant_Review-g297921-d8705747-Reviews-Attention_Cafe-Hat_Yai_Songkhla_Province.html
article.meta_description: These 11 recommendations of great things to do in Hatyai at night will solve your bewilderment.

snippets.text: 1. Try some Thai street food at Greenway Night Market

A visit to Hat Yai would be incomplete without a stop at the Greenway Night Market. It's a good place for either hanging out or hunting for a wide array of tasteful local street foods -- including mango sticky rice, grilled pork, and Thai iced tea. Everything here is reasonably priced and there is something here to suit every palate and craving. 
> #### Greenway Night Market
>
> **Address**:  1406/3 Kanjanavanich Rd., Hat Yai 90110, Thailand
>
> **Opening Hours**:  4 - 10 pm
2. Find incredibly cheap items at Kim Yong Market

snippets.html: A post shared by JoyJa Joy (@joyja_joy) on Mar 6, 2017 at 1:44am PST

snippets.text:
Although Kim Yong Market opens up at the crack of dawn, it's wrong to assume it's only for morning shopping. Open until 7pm, there are plenty of shoppers who make their way here after work, to take in some shopping. The market attracts a host of locals and tourists, who come for the cheap goods, such as perfume, clothing, fresh flowers, makeup, and accessories, as well as imported snacks, from nuts to chips. 
> #### Kim Yong Market
>
> **Address**:  Sang Aretit Rd, Amphoe Hat Yai, Chang Wat Songkhla 90110, Thailand
>
> **Opening Hours**:  4 am - 7 pm
3. Be amazed by the Magic Eye 3D Museum

snippets.html: A post shared by ŸÜŸàÿ± ÿßŸÖÿßŸÜŸäŸÜÿß ÿßÿ≠ŸÖÿØüë∏üèª (@ninvhmd) on Feb 15, 2016 at 6:05pm PST

snippets.text:
The Magic Eye 3D Museum showcases a dazzling 3D wall and tricky floor paintings and is highly recommended for those attracted to modern art. What makes this spot unique are its many paintings made with the illusionary Trompe-l‚Äôoeil technique. The optical illusions that pop out in the various themed galleries will play tricks with your eyes and are great for taking photographs. Put on your craziest expression and pose in front of some of these bizarre and confusing pieces.
> #### Magic Eye 3D Museum
>
> **Address**:  1408 Kanjanavanich Rd | Greenway night market, Hat Yai, Thailand
>
> **Opening Hours**:  9 am - 9 pm

> #### Hat Yai Magic Eye 3D Museum Admission Ticket
>
> **Duration**: Flexible
>
> **Price**: 12.82 USD
>
> [Viator](https://www.viator.com/tours/Hat-Yai/Hat-Yai-Magic-Eye-3D-Museum-Admission-Ticket-Including-Hotel-Pickup/d23620-11861P1)
4. Hit Post Laser Disc Bar & Restaurant

snippets.html: A post shared by JamesRuangsak (@jamesruangsak) on Dec 25, 2015 at 7:19pm PST

snippets.text:
If you're seeking a western-style pub, the Post Laser Disc Bar and Restaurant is the perfect place to dance, enjoy some drinks and the latest beats, at the hip bar. Live Thai bands are also featured here, as well as a large variety of good food, from eastern to western and the fish and chips are worth a try. Be a social butterfly and mingle with the other visitors, for some travel tips and local banter. 
> #### Post Laser Disc Bar and Restaurant
>
> **Address**:  82-84 Thamanoonvithee Road, Hat Yai 90110, Thailand
>
> **Opening Hours**:  9 am - 2 am
5. Visit the Municipal Park

snippets.html: A post shared by UTHAI INTUWONG (@dewdewdd) on Nov 9, 2017 at 6:10am PST

snippets.text:
Those who are hypnotized by cultural sites ought not to worry about finding things to do in Hat Yai at night. Simply head to the Municipal Park to see the mesmerizing Buddha statue. The complex also features a laughing Buddha and an iconic monument of King Rama V. To reach the four-faced Buddha sanctuary, at the peak of Kor Hing Mountain, take the cable car ride.
> #### Municipal Park
>
> **Address**:  445 Rd. Phetkasem. Hat. Hat Yai, Songkhla
>
> **Opening Hours**:  9 am - 9 pm
6. Shop till you drop at Central Festival Hat Yai

snippets.html: A post shared by Jayden Jern (@jaydenjern) on Jul 17, 2017 at 12:05am PDT

snippets.text:
Undeniably, Hat Yai offers never ending opportunities for shopping and Central Festival Hat Yai is just one more example of this. There are plenty of reasons why you should visit one of the most fashionable malls in the entire country, including its countless discounts, great food, a skating rink, karaoke center and more, all under one roof. 
> #### Central Festival Hat Yai 
>
> **Address**:  Kanchanavanich Road, Hat Yai, Thailand
>
> **Opening Hours**:  11 am - 9 pm
7. Chill out at Nectar Pub Hat Yai

snippets.html: A post shared by nectarpubhatyai (@nectarpubhatyai) on Jul 22, 2014 at 2:16am PDT

snippets.text:
Nectar Pub Hat Yai is the best spot to make your evening more memorable and remarkable. Enjoy an unstoppable night, with the funkiest beats and techno music played by DJ Buddha and a lively party hosted by MC Coga. Before the euphoria starts, pick your favorite drink from the assortment of finest cocktails, wine and local beer.

> #### Nectar Pub Hat Yai
>
> **Address**:  99 Jootee Anusorn Rd, Tambon Hat Yai, Amphoe Hat Yai, Chang Wat Songkhla 90110, Thailand
>
> **Opening Hours**:  7 pm - 2 am
8. Enjoy live music at Westside Saloon Pub and Restaurant

snippets.html: A post shared by Dizzy (@aussiedizzy) on Aug 7, 2016 at 7:29pm PDT

snippets.text:
Can't wait to rock your body with another spot for excitement? Then hit the Westside Saloon Pub and Restaurant, which features a live band, as well as classic rock from the 70's and 80's. It doesn't end at here, this offbeat place is also great for drinks and at dinner time -- both the must-try Thai food and the western delicacies are wonderful. 
> ####  Westside Saloon Pub and Restaurant
>
> **Address**:  Thumnoonvithi Rd, Tambon Hat Yai, Amphoe Hat Yai, Chang Wat Songkhla 90110, Thailand
>
> **Opening Hours**:  7 pm - 1 am
9. Have a Thai dinner at Jae Lek Restaurant

snippets.html: A post shared by David Dsym (@david_dsym) on Aug 1, 2015 at 10:24pm PDT

snippets.text:
Fuel up with some local dishes for dinner, at Jae Lek Restaurant, which comes highly recommended. There are a wide number of lip-smacking main courses listed on the menu, from the flavorful Pineapple Fried Rice to the spicy Pad Thai. For a lovely sweet treat to end your impressive dinner, try the Tub Tim Grob, one of the most popular Thai desserts, made from water chestnuts. 
> #### Jae Lek Restaurant
>
> **Address**:  Nipatuthit 2 Rd, Tambon Hat Yai, Amphoe Hat Yai, Chang Wat Songkhla 90110, Thailand
>
> **Opening Hours**:  9 am - 9 pm
10. Visit Lee Garden Plaza for an all you can eat buffet and more

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Lily Chioe (@duabui) on Aug 7, 2017 at 9:58am PDT

The Lee Garden Plaza is a mall in downtown Hat Yai. Many street vendors sell their local cuisines, but there are other options, such as the Sky Buffet. The food is typical of a buffet, with plenty of tasty options, but as it's off the tourist track, the price is excellent value. Other shops and restaurants come recommended, like the authentic Korean food restaurant on the 3rd floor.
View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Lily Chioe (@duabui) on Aug 6, 2017 at 12:11am PDT

Other shopping options include a cosmetics shop, Boots and McDonald's. Many people spend an evening drinking coconut milk, and browsing the stalls, en route to the Central Festival or Diana. > #### Lee Garden Plaza > > **Address**: 29, Prachathipat Road, Hat Yai 90110 > > **Website**: [Lee Garden Plaza](https://web.facebook.com/leegardensplaza/)
11. The Swan restaurant for Thai and western food options

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by “ìreedo–º üïä—Çravel –ΩappŒπne—ï—ïüíã‚ÑìœÉŒΩ—î (@isary_sam) on Jan 13, 2017 at 7:10am PST

The Swan is quiet during the day, but things heat up at night. It's a popular restaurant where diners have options of both western and Thai food. Guests enjoy the homemade steak pies and the chicken and cashew nuts. Drinks may be ordered as it is a bar as well. There's a feeling akin to an English pub, with English Premier League football clubs flags decorating the walls.
View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Ciinderella Kiittenzz (@a_kiittenzz) on Dec 29, 2014 at 7:15am PST

Run by a couple who were in the UK, English is not a problem. Often, people visit to enjoy watching a game of English football. Many retired people and expatriates visit the restaurant to enjoy a bit of British culture in an exotic location. > #### Swan Restaurant > > **Address**: Thanon Thamnoon Vithi Rd, Hat Yai, Thailand
Make your night out more fun in Hat Yai!

Hat Yai, popularly known as a budget shopping destination, has numerous attractions at night, for all types of visitors. From the lively bars and clubs scattered across the city to the shopping malls and restaurants, all are great places to spend your evenings, while you are in the city.

lead_paragraph_embed.value:
There is a large range of options for your extraordinary evenings in Hat Yai, a vibrant gem in Southern Thailand. There is more to this charming city than the amazing Wat Hat Yai Nai, which houses a breathtaking reclining Buddha statue (the third largest in the world), or the Ton Nga Chang Waterfall. The city has more to offer when the sun disappears below the horizon, including night markets, museums and a great selection of pubs and restaurants.

Regardless of your mood, let these 11 best picks help you decide what to do in Hat Yai, at night.

article.guidelines:
##### 1. For listings WITH partner links (getyourguide / viator / klook): 

Category: Things to do 

Tags: things to do

Paragraph Headings: 

- Create a creative and catchy heading for the activity. 

- Example: "North-end Boston secret food tour" should be changed to something like "Indulge in some delicious local fare".

Photos: Not required*

Snippets: Not required*

*Ensure the tour link is copy/pasted in the partner link field for each section


##### 2. For listings WITHOUT partner links:

Category: Things to do 

Tags: things to do

Paragraph Headings: 

- Create a creative and catchy heading for the activity. 

- Example: "North-end Boston secret food tour" should be changed to something like "Indulge in some delicious local fare".

Photos: 
- Include relevant royalty-free / social media photos

- Upload 1 relevant royalty-free image (non-social media image) in the conclusion paragraph to use as the article's main image (ONLY if all listings have social media images)

- Refer to this tutorial guide: http://bit.ly/imagetutorialguide

Snippets: 

- Insert the "Things to do / Tours / Attractions" snippet manually at the end of each listing's paragraph and edit the information accordingly.

navigator.introduction: I am Rofiq from East Java, Indonesia. I am passionate about exploring new places, meeting new people, learning new languages and cultures. I always do solo traveling and backpacking since they are both exciting and challenging. My favorite places are Chiang Mai and Luang Prabang where I found a lot of warmth and hospitality from the local people and explored the regions deeply. I had unforgettable experiences trying fried scorpion in Siem Riep, Cambodia and getting lost in Malaysia. My future plan is to explore India and Sri Lanka. My motto is ‚Äútraveling is the greatest way to understand people and to be a respectful person‚Äù. Terima Kasih!
